This fact can be seen in Figure 4, which shows the change in thesurplus to CNP ratio (lagged one year). The change in the federal surplus toGNP ratio in the mid—l930s was typically less than one percentage point, andwas actually positive in some years. Even in 1941, the first year of asubstantial wartime increase in spending, the surplus to GNP ratio onlyincreased by 6 percentage points.Monetary Policy.
